primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The execution of a commercial contract where humans must first perform the 'responsibility' of hearing and believing to trigger God's 'down payment' (Holy Spirit) until the final 'will call' (redemption).

tekstueel_bewijs: No, there is a part we must play in the plan of salvation
Somebody is called upon to make God's Word 'hearable'
The first human responsibility occurs in this... transaction
the redemption of the purchased possession
this transaction, this exchange of values which is, I take it, the meaning of a contract
he will at last possess us completely
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who must act to secure the Object.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Bible / Preachers
tekstueel_bewijs: he seals us with the Spirit... who corrects us... comforts us
helper.rol_van_god: God is largely a Helper or a secondary Subject who responds to human initiative.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help/seal that marks the human as 'paid for'.

tekstueel_bewijs: if you fail to tell the story
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not Sin or Death as cosmic powers, but rather human failure to communicate or believe.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church's mission to make the word 'hearable'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (You and I)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witnessing) is presented as the necessary prerequisite for the primary program (salvation) to function.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has equipped us to breathe.
He gives us the seal of the Holy Spirit.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must play a part in the plan of salvation.
You and I are called upon... to make the gospel hearable.
You must go to 'Will Call' and pick it up.

voorbeelden: There is a part we must play.
Somebody is called upon to make God's Word hearable.
The trouble with our modern people is we are so 'unsmart'.
There is something that God will not do for us... God cannot do for us.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is driven by obligation (Devoir). It assumes the hearer has the power (Pouvoir) and merely needs to be told their duty.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the threat of Predestination (S2) to Human Responsibility (~S1) to reach the Reward (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human performance of the contract.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low; S2 is dismissed as 'not gibing with the New Testament' rather than being overcome by Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly states God 'cannot' or 'will not' act without human initiative, making man the primary Subject of the salvation narrative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: There is a part we must play in the plan of salvation.
He gives us the spirit in us as the mark that we belong to him!

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He will claim us from 'will call'.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The niece with the mink coat serves as the model for how the believer relates to God's 'down payment'.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Paul (as one who 'put in his hands')
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the one who pays the price and Christ is the one who keeps the deposit; the believer is the passive treasure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; anxiety regarding whether they have made the word 'hearable' enough.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The commercial metaphor is coherent but theologically clashes with the concept of 'gift'.
spanning_punten: The claim that God 'cannot' do things vs the claim that God is 'good' and 'provides'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He touched you... then he said to us, Now that you've got it, let the infection of grace spread.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is a 'seal' or 'mark' rather than the source of the power to believe.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as being 'out of fix' or 'bent', requiring a 'straightening out' rather than a resurrection.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (at the very end, but triggered by man).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is human-centric. God is the merchant, but the human is the customer who must initiate the transaction.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Man is the subject of 'making the word hearable' and 'believing'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God is the one who speaks and God is the one who creates faith.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must make the word hearable,' use 'God breaks through our silence to make His voice heard.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'purchased possession' does nothing to purchase itself.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit gives the power to believe when we are unable.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe Sin as a dead-end that only a resurrection can solve.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is small, the Savior is small.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Salvation is accomplished by Christ; witnessing is the overflow.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The commercial metaphor is engaging, but ensure the 'Free Gift' of the Gospel isn't turned into a 'Layaway Plan' where we pay the installments of faith.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the mink coat story is effective; semiotically, it destroys the concept of unmerited grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Ephesians 1 usually emphasizes God's 'will' and 'pleasure', which this sermon explicitly limits.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite using the word 'grace', the actantial roles are strictly legalistic.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Will Call' metaphor which necessitates a human subject to 'pick up' the item.
